Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the level of support for Trump in Georgia by stating that 70% of all Georgians would vote for him in 2024, when in fact the poll only surveyed likely GOP primary voters.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide a source or evidence for the 70% figure.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the support for Trump among likely GOP primary voters represents the support of all Georgians, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the support for Trump in the poll only reflects the opinions of likely GOP primary voters and not all Georgians.
